content: protest mittens i live in the twin cities in minnesota and since the beginning of 2026 there has a been a large ice presence the escalation of their tactics and not respecting human or constitutional rights does not sit well with me please put your rage and emotions into your mittens and use them for some good trouble #protestmittens #fuckicemittens pattern by virginia cosgriff ravelry virginia718 last updated 5-feb-2026 page 1 of 9 this pattern is for personal use only items made from this pattern may not be sold or produced for commercial purposes protest mittens these mittens are made with worsted because i like thick mittens but they can easily be used with dk or fingering held together i used malabrigo rios but arroyo or cascade 220 superwash would work just as well especially if you are a tight knitter if you are making small kid mittens sport or fingering will make them smaller but you will need to find that gauge notes  i do not recommend highly speckled yarn because it makes the pattern difficult to see  i used 8 circulars which i knit looser on than dpns so if using dpns you might go up a needle size be sure to match the guage  if you want a u instead of a star in the palm there is a chart for it cid 45540 cid 45582 cid 45584 cid 45585 cid 45586 cid 45583 sizing the mitten is approximately 9 inches long 7 5-8 inches around but may differ depending on your gauge to make them bigger or smaller difficulty intermediate due to stranded knitting and duplicate stitch information and supplies gauge 10 sts x 17 row for a 4 square 5cm with us 4 terms & stitches used in stranded/fair isle stitches these will be the larger - co cast on needles - k knit - p - purl switch needle size to obtain gauge - sts stitches - pm place marker materials - k2tog knit two together - mc of worsted or dk yarn 53g/102m 112yd - ssk slip slip knit - cc of worsted or dk yarn 35-40g/70-80m 77- - m1 increase 1 87yd - rib k1 p1 - us2 dpn 8 circular or 24+ for magic loop - backwards loop cast-on - us4 dpn 8 circular or 24+ for magic loop - mc main color - stitch markers x1-4 - cc contrast color - scrap yarn to hold thumb stitches - needle to weave in ends - optional embellishing yarn & capacitive thread for thumb notes section color 1 mc ____________________ color 2 cc _____________________ resources for stranded/fair isle knitting ensuring cc is showing better i hold the mc in my left hand and cc in my right hand because throughout most of this the mc is the accent trying to show through the cc by doing this it creates a better stitch definition to show the design here is a video catching floats as well and holding in both
